column2: SOUTH DAKOTA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: SD

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn as they proceed past them.
column6: stop until the person is well away from the roadway or path of travel.
column8: carefully drive around them.

column2: 2. Arrows on the roadway:
column6: indicate HOV lanes.
column8: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 3. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: Driving within the range.
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 4. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 5. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: signal your intention before changing lanes.
column6: check your blind spots and, mirrors.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road
column8: Sharp turn to the left

column2: 7. The driver is about to:
column6: turn left.
column8: turn right.

column2: 8. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.
column6: stop if necessary.
column8: None of the above.

column2: 9. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: come to a complete stop.

column2: 10. The road is the most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 12. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column6: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.
column8: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.

column2: 13. The yield sign means:
column4: Go. The light will soon be red.
column6: Stop if you can.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 14. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: right turns are not allowed.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 16. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 17. If the roadway is wet, you should:
column6: reduce your speed.
column8: maintain the same speed.

column2: 18. If a pedestrian is illegal crossing in the middle of the street (not at a crosswalk) you:
column6: do not have to stop for them.
column8: should increase your speed, honk your horn and proceed.

column2: 19. Two solid yellow lines between lanes of traffic means:
column6: the lanes are designed to carry traffic in one direction at certain times and in the opposite direction at other times.
column8: passing is permitted on the left.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow
column6: Minimum Speed
column8: Two way Traffic

column2: 21. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 22. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column6: speed up.
column8: show them how to drive defensively.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: This lane is reserved for bicyclists
column6: Bicycles have the right-of-way
column8: Bicycle crossing

column2: 25. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: All of the above.
